popt4jlib

Interface SparseVectorIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, VectorIntf
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DblArray1SparseVector, DblArray1SparseVectorFE, DblArray1SparseVectorMT, FltArray1SparseVector, IntArray1SparseVector

    public interface SparseVectorIntf
extends VectorIntf
    this interface extends the standard VectorIntf in that it provides two methods to allow for (fast) loops over the non-zero (non-default-valued more generally) elements of a sparse vector.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getDefaultValue()
      return the default value for components of this vector (usually, this must be zero).
      int getIthNonZeroPos(int i)
      return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector.
      double getIthNonZeroVal(int i)
      return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector.
      int getNumNonZeros()
      get the number of non-zero elements of this vector.

      • Methods inherited from interface popt4jlib.VectorIntf

        addMul, div, getCoord, getDblArray1, getNumCoords, isAtOrigin, mul, newCopy, newCopyMultBy, newInstance, newInstance, setCoord

    • Method Detail

      • getNumNonZeros

        int getNumNonZeros()
        get the number of non-zero elements of this vector. In case the result of getDefVal() is not-zero, then the method must return the number of non-default-valued components.
        Returns:
        int

      • getIthNonZeroPos

        int getIthNonZeroPos(int i)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector. For example, for the vector v=[0 0 1 2 0], the method getIthNonZeroPos(0) will return 2, and the call getIthNonZeroPos(1) will return 3.

        In case the result of getDefVal() is not-zero, then the method must return the i-th non-default-valued element of this vector.

        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the argument i is <0 or ≥getNumNonZeros(). Also, if this is the zero vector, the method will always throw regardless of the argument passed in.

      • getIthNonZeroVal

        double getIthNonZeroVal(int i)
                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector. For example, for the vector v=[0 0 1 2 0], for a sparse vector where the default value is zero, the method getIthNonZeroVal(0) will return 1, and the call getIthNonZeroPos(1) will return 2.
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        double the i-th non-default (zero unless the class supports non- zero defaults) value of this vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the argument i is <0 or ≥getNumNonZeros(). Also, if this is vector-of-all-defaults, the method will always throw regardless of the argument passed in.

      • getDefaultValue

        double getDefaultValue()
        return the default value for components of this vector (usually, this must be zero). An invariant property is that the number returned must be the same constant for any object throughout its life-time.
        Returns:
        double
